definition: China Association of Amusement Parks and Attractions (CAAPA)
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 You2 yi4 ji1 You2 le4 yuan2 Xie2 hui4
containing_words.word: 中國遊藝機遊樂園協會

definition: group of actors or acrobats at a fair/theatrical troupe

sentences.english: The funfair used to take place in the park near her house.
sentences.chinese: 遊藝會過去常在她家附近的公園裏舉行。

sentences.english: Entertainment places in the past used to give out free tickets to customers.
sentences.chinese: 過去的遊藝場都會發放紅票給顧客。

sentences.english: This is such a large-scale charm Card entertainment community.
sentences.chinese: 這就是這種大型棋牌遊藝社區的魅力。

sentences.english: For this year's Spring Festival, there will be a provincial gathering for entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 今年春節將舉辦全省規模的遊藝會。

sentences.english: Do not remain standing in front of those sitting at a public game.
sentences.chinese: 在遊藝場所裏，不要站在坐着的觀衆前面。

sentences.english: Our village is holding a fete to raise money for the building of the new hall.
sentences.chinese: 我們村裏準備舉行遊藝會，以籌募經費建造禮堂。

sentences.english: Our big ride requests queue in.
sentences.chinese: 我們的遊藝機要求排隊進入。

definition: a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to do with the masses/mass (meeting, movement etc)
to pass on the light of Buddha
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
creative industries (design, music, publishing etc)/abbr. for 文化創意產業|文化创意产业
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
(of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another, abbr. for 薪盡火傳|薪尽火传[xin1 jin4 huo3 chuan2]
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
